==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=1|rs=文00}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[もん]] (mon)
|kanon=[[ぶん]] (bun)
|kun=[[ふみ]] (fumi), [[あや]] (aya)
|nanori=[[かざり]] (kasari), [[ふ]] (fu), [[も]] (mo)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|もん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=もん}} {{m|zh|文|tr=mjun||ornate; a kind of coin; language, literature, a letter, a character}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|もん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|もん}}

# the {{w|Japanese mon (currency)|mon}}, an old [[currency]]
# a unit of [[length]] for measuring the size of one's foot {{qualifier|from the way that the ''mon'' coins would be lined up and used as a kind of [[inch]] marker}}
# a [[character]], a [[letter]]
# [[writing]], something [[written]]
# a [[magical]] [[spell]]
# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|紋}}}} a [[design]], a [[pattern]]
# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|紋}}}} a {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}}

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|en|design}} and {{m|en|crest}} senses are more often spelled {{m|ja|紋}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|文句|もんく}}
* {{ja-r|文言|もんごん}}: the [[phrasing]] or [[wording]] of a piece of [[writing]]
* {{ja-r|文字|もじ}}: a [[character]], a [[letter]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぶん}}
A later borrowing from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ぶん}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''bûn'', {{etyl|hak|-}} ''vûn''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|ぶん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぶん}}

# {{lb|ja|grammar|sort=ふん'}} a [[sentence]]
# [[writing]], [[composition]]
# a [[design]] or [[pattern]] as [[decoration]]
# [[literature]], [[learning]], [[scholarship]]
# [[elegance]], [[refinement]] {{qualifier|especially of writing or wording}}
# a [[saying]], an [[aphorism]], a [[proverb]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|文案|ぶんあん}}
* {{ja-r|文意|ぶんい}}
* {{ja-r|文化|ぶんか}}
* {{ja-r|文官|ぶんかん}}: a [[civil servant]], a [[public official]]
* {{ja-r|文学|ぶんがく}}: [[literature]]
* {{ja-r|文芸|ぶんげい}}
* {{ja-r|文言|ぶんげん}}: the [[phrasing]] or [[wording]] of a piece of [[writing]]; in Chinese contexts, the [[written]] style or [[register]] as opposed to the [[spoken]] style or [[register]]
* {{ja-r|文豪|ぶんごう}}
* {{ja-r|文才|ぶんさい}}
* {{ja-r|文書|ぶんしょ}}
* {{ja-r|文章|ぶんしょう}}
* {{ja-r|文人|ぶんじん}}
* {{ja-r|文責|ぶんせき}}
* {{ja-r|文体|ぶんたい}}
* {{ja-r|文筆|ぶんぴつ}}: [[writing]], [[literary]] [[work]], [[literature]]
* {{ja-r|文法|ぶんぽう}}: [[grammar]]
* {{ja-r|文末|ぶんまつ}}
* {{ja-r|文脈|ぶんみゃく}}: [[genre]]
* {{ja-r|文民|ぶんみん}}
* {{ja-r|文明|ぶんめい}}: [[civilization]]
* {{ja-r|文面|ぶんめん}}
* {{ja-r|論文|ろんぶん}}: [[thesis]]
* {{ja-r|博士論文|はくし ろんぶん}}: a Ph.D. thesis
* {{ja-r|礼文島|れぶんとう}}: {{w|Rebun Island}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ふみ}}
Possibly a shift from an older {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived reading ''pun''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Earlier Japanese writing was ambiguous regarding the final ''n'' sound spelled {{m|ja|ん}} in modern Japanese, with this sound often spelled (and possibly pronounced) as {{m|ja|む|tr=mu}} instead.

{{IPAchar|*/pumu/}} → {{IPAchar|/pumi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸumi/}}

This reading appears in the {{w|Heian period}}, in works such as ''{{w|The Tale of Genji}}''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ふみ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふみ}}

# [[writing]], something [[written]]
# a [[letter]] {{qualifier|written communication}}, an [[epistle]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ふみ|archaic}} [[study]], [[scholarship]] {{qualifier|especially of classical Chinese}}
# a style of {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|letter, epistle}} {{ja-r|手紙|てがみ}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|恋%文|こい%ぶみ}}: a [[love letter]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あや}}
Uncertain.  Appears in texts from the early {{w|Heian period}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あや|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あや}}

# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|紋}}, {{m|ja|綾}}}}
## a [[pattern]], a [[design]], especially one with [[diagonally]] [[crossing]] lines
## a [[diagonal]] [[crossing]]
## a [[flowery]] [[expression]] or [[turn of phrase]]
## a [[plot]], a [[scheme]]
## a [[refrain]] or recurring [[phrase]] in a piece of [[music]]
## a [[harder]] [[vein]] or [[grain]] in a leaf or piece of wood or bamboo
## a [[stain]], a [[blemish]]
## a [[mediator]], a [[go-between]] {{qualifier|apparently from the way that a go-between can make the relationship more indirect and indistinct}}
## a small indistinct [[fluctuation]] in a trend line
# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|綾}}, {{m|ja|絢}}}}
## a kind of [[woven]] [[silk]] [[textile]] with a diagonally crossing pattern
## short for {{m|ja|綾織|tr=ayaori}}: a [[twill]] [[weave]]; someone who [[weave]]s [[twill]]
## short for {{m|ja|綾竹|tr=ayadake}}: in a [[loom]], a [[bamboo]] [[pole]] placed between the [[heddle]] and the [[back beam]] or [[platen]], used to improve the handling
## short for {{m|ja|綾取り|tr=ayatori}}: [[cat's cradle]]

=====Usage notes=====
For the second group of senses, the {{m|ja|綾}} spelling is more common.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|奇|あや}}, {{ja-r|怪|あや}}: [[mystifying]], [[mysterious]], [[strange]] {{qualifier|from the way that an ''aya'' pattern could confound the eyes}}
* {{ja-r|綾織|あやおり}}: a [[twill]] [[weave]]; someone who [[weave]]s [[twill]]
* {{ja-r|綾竹|あやだけ}}: in a [[loom]], a [[bamboo]] [[pole]] placed between the [[heddle]] and the [[back-beam]] or [[platen]], used to improve the handling
* {{ja-r|綾取り|あやとり}}: [[cat's cradle]]
{{der-bottom}}
